COMMAND.NAME: addsyntaxmap
COMMAND.PARAMETER: syntaxMapName The name that this syntax map will be known to e93 by.

PARAMETER.NAME: syntaxMap
PARAMETER.P: A syntax map is the data structure which gives e93 all the information it needs to search through a document, and apply styles to the text which the map specifies.
See: Syntax maps for more information.

DESCRIPTION.P: Create a syntax highlighting map from a list of expressions and a list of mappings from expressions to styles.
NOTE: this can be used to replace an existing syntax map, but if the existing map is in use by any buffer which is busy, this will fail before it does anything.

STATUS.P:
The addsyntaxmap command will return an error in the following cases:
syntaxMapName is not provided.

syntaxMap is not provided.
syntaxMap is not valid.
